CVE.summary: The kg_accept_krb5 function in krb5/accept_sec_context.c in the GSS-API library in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.7.1 and 1.8 before 1.8.2, as used in kadmind and other applications, does not properly check for invalid GSS-API tokens, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an AP-REQ message in which the authenticator s checksum field is missing.

IAVM.title: Multiple Vulnerabilities in VMware vCenter Server 4.0 and vCenter Update Manager 4.0

vFeed.Product: vFeed - The Correlated Vulnerability and Threat Database
vFeed.Author: NJ OUCHN

Oval.title: ELSA-2010:0987: java-1.6.0-ibm security and bug fix update (Critical)
RHSA-2010:0987: java-1.6.0-ibm security and bug fix update (Critical)
HP-UX Running Kerberos, Remote Denial of Service (DoS), Execution of Arbitrary Code

The kg_accept_krb5 function in krb5/accept_sec_context.c in the GSS-API library in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.7.1 and 1.8 before 1.8.2, as used in kadmind and other applications, does not properly check for invalid GSS-API tokens, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and daemon crash) via an AP-REQ message in which the authenticator's checksum field is missing.
VMware ESX,Service Console update for krb5.
VMware third party component updates for VMware vCenter Server, vCenter Update Manager, ESXi and ESX
DEPRECATED: ELSA-2010:0987: java-1.6.0-ibm security and bug fix update (Critical)
